identificationModule.briefTitle: Pembrolizumab versus paclitaxel for previously treated advanced gastric or gastroesophageal junction cancer in Asian patients
identificationModule.officialTitle: Pembrolizumab versus paclitaxel for previously treated advanced gastric or gastroesophageal junction cancer (KEYNOTE-063): A randomized, open-label, phase 3 trial in Asian patients

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Patients were randomly assigned 1:1 to receive 200 mg of pembrolizumab intravenously every 3 weeks or 80 mg/m² of paclitaxel intravenously on days 1, 8, and 15 of each 4-week cycle. Patients were stratified by time to progression on first-line therapy (<6 vs ≥6 months) and ECOG PS (0 vs 1).

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: This was a randomized, open-label, phase 3 study.

armGroups.label: Pembrolizumab
armGroups.description: Patients received 200 mg of pembrolizumab intravenously every 3 weeks for up to 35 cycles (approximately 2 years) or until disease progression, intolerable toxicity, investigator decision, or patient withdrawal of consent.

armGroups.label: Paclitaxel
armGroups.description: Patients received 80 mg/m² of paclitaxel intravenously on days 1, 8, and 15 of each 4-week cycle until disease progression, intolerable toxicity, investigator decision, or patient withdrawal of consent.

interventions.name: Pembrolizumab
interventions.description: 200 mg administered intravenously every 3 weeks for up to 35 cycles (approximately 2 years)

interventions.name: Paclitaxel
interventions.description: 80 mg/m² administered intravenously on days 1, 8, and 15 of each 4-week cycle
